structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Crime Committed In Commonwealth Resulting In Death Outside Commonwealth
law.text: If a mortal wound is given, or if other violence or injury is inflicted, or if poison is administered, in any county of the commonwealth, by means whereof death ensues without the commonwealth, the homicide may be prosecuted and punished in the county where the act was committed.
